alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior; Northeastern Mendocino Interior; Northern Humboldt Interior; Northern Lake County; Northwestern Mendocino Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 25 at 2:40AM PST until February 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 2500 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 7 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch above 1500 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 40 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest California. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 AM to 1 PM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday evening through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
